lustre/tests/ll_sparseness_verify.c

00031  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00032  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00033  *
00034  * lustre/tests/ll_sparseness_verify.c
00035  *
00036  * The companion to ll_sparseness_write; walk all the bytes in the file.
00037  * the bytes at the offsets specified on the command line must be '+', as
00038  * previously written by ll_sparseness_write.  All other bytes must be 0.
00039  */
00040 
00041 #include <stdio.h>
00042 #include <stdlib.h>
00043 #include <unistd.h>
00044 #include <string.h>
00045 #include <errno.h>
00046 #include <sys/types.h>
00047 #include <sys/wait.h>
00048 #include <sys/stat.h>
00049 #include <fcntl.h>
00050 #include <stdarg.h>
00051 
00052 #define BUFSIZE (1024*1024)    
00053 
00054 void error(char *fmt, ...)
00055 {
00056         va_list ap;
00057         va_start(ap, fmt);
00058         vfprintf(stderr, fmt, ap);
00059         va_end(ap);
00060         exit(1);
00061 }
00062 
00063 int compare_offsets(const void *a, const void *b)
00064 {
00065         off_t *A = (off_t *)a;
00066         off_t *B = (off_t *)b;
00067         return *A - *B;
00068 }
00069 
00070 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00071 {
00072         unsigned int num_offsets, cur_off = 0, i;
00073         off_t *offsets, pos = 0, end_of_buf = 0;
00074         char *end, *buf;
00075         struct stat st;
00076         ssize_t ret;
00077         int fd;
00078 
00079         if (argc < 3)
00080                 error("Usage: %s <filename> <offset> [ offset ... ]\n", 
00081                        argv[0]);
00082 
00083         fd = open(argv[1], O_RDONLY);
00084         if (fd < 0)
00085                 error("couldn't open %s: %s\n", argv[1], strerror(errno));
00086 
00087         buf = malloc(BUFSIZE);
00088         if (buf == NULL)
00089                 error("can't allocate buffer\n");
00090 
00091         num_offsets = argc - 2;
00092         offsets = calloc(sizeof(offsets[0]), num_offsets);
00093         for (i = 0; i < num_offsets; i++) {
00094                 offsets[i] = strtoul(argv[i + 2], &end, 10);
00095                 if (*end) 
00096                         error("couldn't parse offset '%s'\n", argv[i + 2]);
00097         }
00098         qsort(offsets, num_offsets, sizeof(offsets[0]), compare_offsets);
00099 
00100         if (fstat(fd, &st) < 0)
00101                 error("stat: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00102 
00103         for (i = 0; pos < st.st_size; i++, pos++) {
00104                 if (pos == end_of_buf) {
00105                         ret = read(fd, buf, BUFSIZE);
00106                         if (ret < 0)
00107                                 error("read(): %s\n", strerror(errno));
00108                         end_of_buf = pos + ret;
00109                         if (end_of_buf > st.st_size)
00110                                 error("read %d bytes past file size?\n",
00111                                       end_of_buf - st.st_size);
00112                         i = 0;
00113                 }
00114 
00115                 /* check for 0 when we aren't at a given offset */
00116                 if (cur_off >= num_offsets || pos != offsets[cur_off]) {
00117                         if (buf[i] != 0) 
00118                                 error("found char 0x%x at pos %lu instead of "
00119                                        "0x0\n", buf[i], (long)pos);
00120                         continue;
00121                 }
00122 
00123                 /* the command line asks us to check for + at this offset */
00124                 if (buf[i] != '+') 
00125                         error("found char 0x%x at pos %lu instead of "
00126                                "'.'\n", buf[i], (long)pos);
00127 
00128                 /* skip over duplicate offset arguments */
00129                 while (cur_off < num_offsets && offsets[cur_off] == pos)
00130                         cur_off++;
00131         }
00132         /* don't bother freeing or closing.. */
00133         return 0;
00134 }
